page.title: 07HOUSING AROUND LOCHAR MOSS
page.content: The houses in our block are predominantly farmhouses and cottages some of which are no longer part of the farms but are privately owned. One such cottage is {NORFOLK COTTAGE -formerly Kelwood Cottage.On one wall of this you can find the {NORFOLK {COAT-OF-ARMS}since the Duke of Norfolk owned much of the land in this area. A modern house in this area-{PLACE {OF CRAIGS}-is built on the site of a Peel Tower.In the 13th Century several Peel Towers were built in this area to protect families living in the area by giving early warning of enemy attack. Where Place of Craigs is now built a large stone,perhaps the corner stone has been uncovered as well as a paved area which may have been the floor of the Peel Towers.
